page.title: 02 LOCAL HISTORY I
page.content: At the heart of the centre of Cannock is the Parish Church of St Luke. According to church records it was founded early as 1143 and had a chantry and a grammar school linked with it. The oldest remaining part of the church is the church tower,which dates from the 14th century. The church was extended in 1878 by two bays and a chancel. In 1949 a lovely war memorial chapel was added to the south side. Alongside the church is the church centre which is well fitted and furnished and has all the facilities for the social needs of the parish,as well as administrative block.
